title: Yielding a Tulip
description:
Asynchronised operations are good. Callbacks are not. Named callbacks
clutter scopes and are disruptive. Anonymous callbacks create deeply
nested code and become totally unreadable—Python does not even support
that because it just lacks style! We deserve better. Let's take a look
on how Python 3.4's new "asyncio" (aka Tulip) brings elegance to async
tasks.

About the speaker

TP is a professional software engineer enjoying building things. He
writes C++ because his boss pays him to do so, but loves Python and
constantly tries to sneak it into his work as much as he can.
